abstract: At a Paris market's open-air aisle, the star of the show is jambon.
snippet: At a Paris market's open-air aisle, the star of the show is jambon.
lead_paragraph: Hamming it up is an important part of the fun for antiquers who descend upon the biannual Foire Nationale à la Brocante et aux Jambons, on the pretty little island of Chatou in the Seine just a half hour outside of Paris. First of all, shoppers know that a bit of good-humored banter with the seller of a coveted item often leads to a much better "meilleur prix" (best price). But they also know that the fair's wide open-air aisle known as the Boulevard Voltaire might just as well be called pig alley.
